column2: COLORADO DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.
column10: not turn right.

column2: 2. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column8: minimum speed
column10: reaction speed

column2: 3. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column8: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column10: Take a cold shower before driving.

column2: 4. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: less dangerous
column10: darker

column2: 5. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line

column2: 6. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column10: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 7. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column8: Warning signs (diamond)
column10: None of the above.

column2: 8. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column8: use alternate routes.
column10: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 9. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.
column6: where there is a red light.
column8: at an intersection with a stop sign.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 10. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the right may pass.
column6: passing is permitted in either direction.
column8: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the left may pass.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column8: Parking is not allowed.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 12. Smoking while driving:
column8: helps increase driver alertness.
column10: is distracting.

column2: 13. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: steer right
column10: stay in the center of your lane

column2: 14. Never make a U-turn from:
column8: the left lane.
column10: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 15. Your BAC depends on:
column6: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 16. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column10: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.

column2: 17. To enter a freeway:
column4: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column6: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column8: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column10: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column8: All traffic turn right
column10: No right turn

column2: 19. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 20. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column8: look for a detour or another route.
column10: remove the sign and move forward.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column8: Stop if necessary
column10: Lane ends

column2: 22. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column8: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 23. Aggressive drivers:
column8: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 24. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column6: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column8: Drivers are not required to stop.
column10: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.

column2: 25. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column8: Improved judgement
column10: Improved coordination
